name: Pritisangam (Confluence of Krishna and Koyna Rivers)
description: Unique T-shaped confluence. Peaceful spot with a landscaped garden and a memorial of Yashwantrao Chavan.

name: Krishna Ghat
description: Developed riverfront area with gardens and walkways. Great for evening walks and river views.

name: Devi Krishnamai Temple
description: Sacred temple near the Krishna River. Important spiritual hub for locals.

name: Naktya Ravlyachi Vihir (Ancient Stepwell)
description: Architecturally significant historic well. Symbol of ancient water management.

name: Agashiv Caves
description: Ancient Buddhist rock-cut caves. Located on Agashiv Hill, approx. 4 km from the city center.

name: Sadashivgad Fort
description: Built by Shivaji Maharaj. Offers panoramic views and houses an old Shiva temple.

name: Vasantgad Fort
description: Near Talbid village (13 km from Karad). Known for its strategic importance during the Maratha period.

name: Koyna Dam
description: Major hydroelectric project. Scenic picnic spot surrounded by forested hills.

name: Mayani Bird Sanctuary
description: Birdwatching hotspot with migratory and native birds. Ideal during winter months.

name: Kaas Plateau (Kaas Pathar)
description: UNESCO World Heritage site. Famed for monsoon wildflowers and unique biodiversity.

name: Yashwantrao Chavan Samadhi & Museum
description: Memorial of Maharashtraâ€™s first Chief Minister. Museum exhibits related to his political legacy.

name: Talbid
description: Historical village linked with Shivaji Maharaj. Close to Vasantgad; offers insight into Maratha history.
